head.title: Suspect Shot and Killed While in Police Custody

hedline.hl1: Suspect Shot and Killed While in Police Custody

abstract.p: Guy Walsifer, 40-year-old burglary suspect, is shot and killed by two detectives at headquarters of Cedar Grove (NJ) police dept after he wrestles weapon away from third detective and threatened to kill him (S)

block.p: A burglary suspect was shot and killed by two detectives at the headquarters of the Cedar Grove Police Department on Thursday after he wrestled a weapon away from a third detective and threatened to kill him, county prosecutors said.

The burglary suspect, Guy Walsifer, 40, of West Milford, was undergoing questioning in a basement interrogation room when he struck the detective, Guy Trogani, and managed to take away Detective Trogani's 9-millimeter pistol, Ray Weiss, a spokesman for the Essex County Prosecutor's Office, said yesterday. When Mr. Walsifer pointed the gun at Detective Trogani, two other detectives, Charles Lagattuta and Andrew McPhail, fired several shots at him, Mr. Weiss said.

A burglary suspect was shot and killed by two detectives at the headquarters of the Cedar Grove Police Department on Thursday after he wrestled a weapon away from a third detective and threatened to kill him, county prosecutors said.

The burglary suspect, Guy Walsifer, 40, of West Milford, was undergoing questioning in a basement interrogation room when he struck the detective, Guy Trogani, and managed to take away Detective Trogani's 9-millimeter pistol, Ray Weiss, a spokesman for the Essex County Prosecutor's Office, said yesterday. When Mr. Walsifer pointed the gun at Detective Trogani, two other detectives, Charles Lagattuta and Andrew McPhail, fired several shots at him, Mr. Weiss said.

Mr. Walsifer was completing a statement to the detectives and was about to be fingerprinted when he attacked Detective Trogani. He had been arrested Wednesday night in connection with a burglary and was a suspect in several other unsolved burglaries in Essex and Passaic Counties, Mr. Weiss said.
